subject: headphone masterpiece
body:
the other day in the car, i remembered cody chesnutt's album _[the headphone masterpiece](https://open.spotify.com/album/4DO0EipTAYZYaUDSoEVK98)_, a double album of demos recorded in a bedroom to be heard on a [specific set of headphones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sony_MDR-V6) (though they work in any context), which i was first introduced to in [that miranda july movie](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t87QILBZd_I) about end-to-end intimacy with "[5 on a joyride](https://open.spotify.com/track/6raOkubHko3QRm3T13nCNX)," an ache of a delicate ballad with keening falsetto over peals of wurlitzer arpeggios, a song and a style that would be enough to hang a career on but also there's such variety, "[boylife in america](https://open.spotify.com/track/0OdF7EWHZsAFAXT0jmw0Wa)" (jaunty and profane, the falsetto strained with joy) "[the seed](https://open.spotify.com/track/252B0wvE4g0Z2vz5Q6aNDp)" (probably not as good as [the version with the roots](https://open.spotify.com/track/4qQXGap2O10aMyHdMAAaVk) but more pointed and hymn-like), "[my women my guitars](https://open.spotify.com/track/7xzXIcekDq1RQxlVhzaynf)" (such a good chorus with a splash of harmonica at the end as the cherry on top), "[enough of nothing](https://open.spotify.com/track/0KLD2mlGrGFwHBkDqyj0Ne)" (dreamy acoustic guitar miniature), and the single "[look good in leather](https://open.spotify.com/track/6Pe17mnex6IT7C72p00xOj)" (feel-good sunshine pump-up music).

i'm thankful to have experienced so many wonderful things in my life that i'm always forgetting wonderful things and i'm thankful that sometimes a neuron fires and they come back to me and i can have them again in the present.
